p: In addition to RdRP, PLpro, and 3CLpro, helicases and glycogen synthase kinase 3 (GSK3) should also be of interest because they are essential components during the coronavirus replication process in host cells and could act as viable targets for anti‐SARS/MERS chemical therapies, according to studies that have already been confirmed by researchers (Adedeji et al., 2012; Adedeji et al., 2014; Mizutani et al., 2006; Wu et al., 2009). Although there have been no related approved inhibitor‐based anti‐SARS‐CoV‐2 therapies so far, those candidate compounds, especially remdesivir, could serve as potential leads and clinical medicines for developing effective anti‐SARS‐CoV‐2 drugs with interpretation of the crystal structure of replicases.
